title: 111_hr5698
content: PROTECTION OF EMPLOYEES FROM RETALIATION BY THEIR EMPLOYER FOR COOPERATING IN INVESTIGATIONS. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation against employees who report violations, refuse to participate in noncompliant conduct, or provide information related to the Act. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation against employees who report violations, refuse to participate in noncompliant conduct, or provide information related to the Act. Employees covered by this section who allege discrimination by an employer may bring an enforcement action with specific legal procedures and remedies. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation against employees who report violations or refuse to participate in noncompliant conduct. Employees can seek district court review within 90 days of receiving a final determination by the Secretary of Labor. Any reference to this Act includes provisions of law enacted by the amendment. The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to include a new section prohibiting retaliation. The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to prohibit retaliation against employees for reporting violations or refusing to participate in noncompliant conduct. Employees covered by this section are protected from retaliation for providing information to Congress or participating in proceedings related to the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act. They can take enforcement action if they experience discrimination by their employer. Employees protected from retaliation for providing information to Congress or participating in proceedings related to the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act can seek district court review within 90 days of receiving a final determination by the Secretary of Labor.
